definition: 4th note in pentatonic scale 五音[wu3 yin1], roughly sol/see also 徵|征[zheng1]
to invite/to recruit/to levy (taxes)/to draft (troops)/phenomenon/symptom/characteristic sign (used as proof)/evidence

sentences.english: The doctor managed to took the patient's mind off the symptom.
sentences.chinese: 醫生設法使病人不去想徵狀。

sentences.english: The more common symptoms are nasal discharge , poor appetite, and lethargy.
sentences.chinese: 比較常見的徵狀是流鼻涕，食慾不佳以及昏睡。

sentences.english: The loose bearing may generally be isolated by shorting spark plugs .
sentences.chinese: 軸承鬆動的徵狀通常可能會被短路的火花塞孤立出來。

sentences.english: Symptoms some people have been reporting have been the experience of intense energy moving through their bodies.
sentences.chinese: 許多人說經驗到強的能量通過他們的全身得徵狀。

sentences.english: Her brother was also reportedly taken to hospital with similar symptoms.
sentences.chinese: 據悉，女童的一名兄弟也因出現相似徵狀被送往醫院。

sentences.english: Return for severe vomiting or diarrhea or persistence for more that tow days.
sentences.chinese: 嚴重噁心，嘔吐或徵狀超逾兩天。

definition: to see a doctor/to seek medical advice
to have a high temperature/feverish/unable to think calmly/to emit heat
range (the difference between the lowest and highest values)
to seek medical treatment/to see a doctor
